alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 408 PM EDT, the Summerville Police Department reported numerous impassable or closed due to persisting flood waters. In addition, broadcast media indicates areas off of Ashley Phosphate, on Peppermill Parkway, had a significant about of flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, generally over the Interstate 26 corridor from the Charleston Airport north to Summerville. Flood waters are expected to slowly recede through the rest of this afternoon into early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, College Park, Crowfield Plantation, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Knightsville, Lincolnville, Charleston Southern University, Summerville Medical Center, Otranto, Oakbrook, Driggerstown, Greggs Landing and Northwoods Mall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
